com.rockhoppertech.music

Class PitchFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rockhoppertech.music.PitchFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class PitchFormat
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Formats the text representation of a Pitch. PitchFormat pf = PitchFormat.instance(); pf.setJustification(PitchFormat.CENTER_JUSTIFY); pf.setWidth(4); pf.format(pitch);
    Author:
    Gene De Lisa
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setDisplaySharps

        public void setDisplaySharps()

        Displays string representation as sharps. You will see C# and not Df.

      • setDisplayFlats

        public void setDisplayFlats()

        Displays string representation as flats. You will see Df and not C#.

      • setJustification

        public void setJustification(int j)
        Justification of string representation
        Parameters:
        j - Can be one of Pitch.LEFT_JUSTIFY, Pitch.RIGHT_JUSTIFY, Pitch.CENTER_JUSTIFY

      • midiNumberToString

        public static String midiNumberToString(int midiNumber)

        flats are displayed, the justification is centered, and the width is 3

        Parameters:
        midiNumber - the midi number. 60 is middle c (C5)
        Returns:
        a string representation of a midi number

      • midiNumberToString

        public static String midiNumberToString(int midiNumber,
                        boolean pdisplayAsSharp,
                        int justification,
                        int width)

        The version for micromanaging control freaks.

        Parameters:
        midiNumber - the midi number. 60 is middle c (C5)
        pdisplayAsSharp - use # or f for accidentals
        justification - can be any of the static constants
        width - the string length returned
        Returns:
        a string representation of a midi number

        Returns:

      • stringToMidiNumber

        public static int stringToMidiNumber(String pitch)

        Return the MIDI pitch number for the given string which contains the octave number. C5 is middle C.

        Parameters:
        pitch - the string to convert
        Returns:
        the midinumber of the string parameter

      • isAccidental

        public static boolean isAccidental(int num)

        Checks to see if the num mod 12 has an accidental (is not diatonic).

        Parameters:
        num - the MIDI pitch number
        Returns:
        true if the num is not diatonic

      • format

        public String format(Pitch p)

        This is the main method to use to format a Pitch. It uses the previously set intance variables for sharps/flats, justification and width.

        Parameters:
        p - the pitch to format
        Returns:
        a formatted String

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public static void main(String[] args)
        just a test.
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments ignored.

      • getPitchString

        public static String getPitchString(Pitch p)

        You might want just the pitch name without the octave designation. This is handy when building chords for example.

        Given 60 you will get C, 61 is Df

        Parameters:
        p - The pitch
        Returns:
        the pitch as a string

      • getPitchString

        public static String getPitchString(Pitch p,
                    boolean pdisplayAsSharp)
        Parameters:
        p - the pitch
        pdisplayAsSharp - should the string be spelled as sharps or flats?
        Returns:
        the pitch string

      • getPitchString

        public static String getPitchString(int midiNumber)

        You might want just the pitch name without the octave designation. This is handy when building chords or key signatures for example.

        Given 60 you will get C, 61 is Df

        Parameters:
        midiNumber - the MIDI pitch number
        Returns:
        the pitch string

      • getPitchString

        public static String getPitchString(int midiNumber,
                    boolean pdisplayAsSharp)
        Parameters:
        midiNumber - the midi pitch number
        pdisplayAsSharp - display as flat or sharp
        Returns:
        the pitch string
